title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 2763/84 of 28 September 1984 increasing for part of the 1984/85 marketing year the minimum size of apples allowed to be marketed
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 2763/84
of 28 September 1984
increasing for part of the 1984/85 marketing year the minimum size of apples allowed to be marketed
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN
COMMUNITIES
main_body:
1. Notwithstanding the common quality standards laid down by Regulation (EEC) No 1641/71, apples from the 1984 crop of large-fruit varieties, less than 60 mm in size, may not be marketed as from 1 January 1985 for delivery fresh to the consumer.
2. Paragraph 1 shall not apply to apples of the 'Morgenduft' and 'Gravensteiner' varieties.
3. Paragraphs 1 and 2 shall apply both to products marketed within the Community and to those exported to non-member countries.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the third day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
